bibl.title: G.M. Savage v. William Billings. Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: In the District Court of the Second Judicial District of Washington Territory holding terms at Olympia, before Hon John P. Hoyt Dist Judge at Chambers March 29th 1884.
G.M. Savage Plaintiff vs Wm Billings Sheriff of Thurston County and Keeper of the jail thereof } Habeas corpus

Upon the petition of G.M. Savage an order having been issued to Wm Billings Sheriff of Thurston County and Keeper of the jial thereof, by the judge of said Court, directing the said Sheriff to bring the said Savage before said Judge and to show by what authority he holds said Savage in custody and confinement, and the said Wm Billings is to said order having appeared before me bringing the body of said G.M. Savage as commanded at Chambers in Olympia on this 29th day of March 1884 and made his retun to said order, that he hold the said G.M. Savage in custody and confinement by virtue of an order of Commitment issued out of and under the seal of the Probate Court of Chehalis County in said Territory, commanding him to receive and safely keep the said Savage until discharged by due process of law, and the said Sheriff having produced said warrant of commitment after hearing the argument of counsel upon both sides it is found by the court that said warrant of commitment was issued without authority of law and it is considered and adjudged that the said G.M. Savage be forthwith released by said Sheriff and Keeper of the jail of Thurston County from his custody under and by virtue thereof, and that the said G.M. Savage have judgment against Chehalis County for his costs and expenses in this behalf is .
At chambers this 29th day of March A.D. 1884. John P. Hoyt Judge
Received and Filed March 29 1884 R.S. O'Rion Clerk.
